intro: Sambirania plicata, commonly known as the pleated sambirania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, pleated leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the wet season. Sambirania plicata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
